page.title: 01INTRO S.E.BRIDGNORTH SALOP
page.content: The area concerned is about 2km{south {of Bridgnorth in South Shropshire}in the West Midlands. It straddles the {River Severn,}which is Britain's longest river. The landscape is gently undulating, ranging from 118m to 30m. The area is largely{rural}with intensive agriculture; there is also a large area of coniferous woodland. There are 3 villages, Eardington, Quatt and Quatford,a number of hamlets such as Mose and Astbury and several farms. The main road passing through is the A442 from Bridgnorth to Kidderminster. Economically the area is dominated by farming, although in this scenic part of Shropshire tourism is important. The area also has many retired people.{Dudmaston Hall}near Quatt was recorded in the original Domesday Book.
